Key Arguments: The legislation is perceived as a means to restrict freedom of speech and criticism of the government.
The government has exempted itself from the provisions, which is seen as hypocritical.
Existing laws are deemed sufficient to handle misinformation and disinformation.
The proposed committee to decide on misinformation is seen as potentially biased and unqualified.
Concerns about gender bias in the composition of the committee.
The legislation could suppress legitimate dissent and protest.
Potential for misuse and weaponization of the legislation against individuals.
Lack of clarity on what constitutes 'harm' and 'misinformation'.
Notable Quotes: This legislation is simply about nothing else than restricting freedom to criticise the Government of the day.
Most telling is that Government has exempted itself from the provisions of this legislation, how funny.
A ‘committee’ of five people is going to be vested with the power and responsibility of deciding what is ‘truth’.
Harm I believe will essentially be whatever ACMA thinks might be damaging at the time, and that is unacceptable.
